data.title: Former Revolution player Andy Marte dies in car crash
data.meta_description: Andy Marte, a former York Revolution player\u00a0who went on to the big leagues,\u00a0died early Sunday in a crash that occurred\u00a0in his native Dominican Republic.
data.text:
Andy Marte, a former York Revolution player who went on to the big leagues, died early Sunday in a crash that occurred in his native Dominican Republic.

Metropolitan traffic authorities say Marte, 33, died when the Mercedes Benz he was driving hit a house along a road between San Francisco de Macoris and Pimentel, about 95 miles north of the capital.

The York Revolution tweeted condolences on Sunday: "Marte, who was with York in 2013, was a consummate pro, highly respected by his teammates, and one of the nicest men off the field as well."

After his time in York, Marte went on to play infield for several Major League teams, including the Atlanta Braves, Cleveland Indians and Arizona Diamondbacks, and was most recently playing in the Korean league. At the time of his death, he was in the Dominican winter league with the Aguilas Cibaenas team.

Since the Revs began play in 2007, Marte's death marks at least the second unexpected death of a former player. Frank Castillo died in 2013 in a drowning incident.
